LIGHTS.OMNI_INTENSITY: The intensity multiplier factor of the omni light

LIGHTS.DIRECTIONAL_INTENSITY: The intensity multiplier factor of the directional light

LIGHTS.SPOT_CONE_ANGLE: The cone angle of the spot light
LIGHTS.SPOT_INTENSITY: The intensity multiplier factor of the spot light

ITEM_PROPERTIES.ITEM_TOO_BIG: You cannot scale this item to larger than %0m in x or z direction.

WEATHER_EDITOR.SPECIAL_EFFECT_FILE: Special Effect File Special Effect File to attach to the camera when the system is summoned
WEATHER_EDITOR.RAIN_AMOUNT: Rain Amount Amount of rain for the weather system Values range from 0.0 to 1.0
WEATHER_EDITOR.SUNLIGHT: Sun Additional colour tint for the time-of-day sunlight The multiplier allows over-brightening of the sunlight
WEATHER_EDITOR.AMBIENT: Ambient Additional colour tint for the time-of-day ambient lighting The multiplier allows over-brightening of the ambient lighting
WEATHER_EDITOR.FOG: Fog Colour tint for the time-of-day fog The density parameter adds extra fog into the scene Density values range from 1.0 (no extra fog) to 5.0 (thick fog)
WEATHER_EDITOR.FOG_FACTOR: Sky Box Fog Response Specifies how the sky boxes respond to the fog density parameter above This value ranges from 0.0 (sky boxes receive no extra fog) to 2.0 (sky boxes respond strongly to extra fog)
WEATHER_EDITOR.WIND_SPEED: Wind Speed The wind speed, in metres per second
WEATHER_EDITOR.WIND_GUSTINESS: Wind Gustiness Specifies how much random variation there is in the wind speed
WEATHER_EDITOR.ATTENUATION: Attenuation Colour tint applied to each pass of the bloom filter With a higher number of bloom passes, the blooming becomes more sensitive to this colour tint
WEATHER_EDITOR.NUM_PASSES: Num Passes Number of blurring passes for the bloom filter Setting this to a higher value provides a larger colour bleed area, but at an added performance cost
WEATHER_EDITOR.SENSITIVITY: Sensitivity Specifies how sensitive the bloom filter is to bright colours Setting this to a low value causes the bloom effect respond to dark colours and become washed out Higher values cause the bloom filter to respond only to brighter colours
WEATHER_EDITOR.FILTER_WIDTH: Filter Width Specifies the width of the blurring kernel for the bloom filter Higher values provide a larger colour bleed area, with no added performance cost Specifying a high filter width, with a low number of passes can make the bloom filter look fragmented

TERRAIN_FUNCTOR.CANNOT_EDITOR_UNLOCKED_TERRAIN: Could not edit terrain of non-locked chunk. Please go to Project panel to lock it before editing.

CHUNK_STATIONNODE.LINK_IN_PRELOAD_NOT_IN_LINK: Link in preload_ not in links_

WATER.TOO_MANY_VERTICES: WARNING! Water surface contains excess vertices, please INCREASE the "Mesh Size" parameter

WORLD_EDITOR_DIRECTOR_PY.FAILED_TO_CHANGE_PP_CHAIN: Failed to change the the post-processing chain, it's modified in the Post-Processing Panel. Save it or discard changes first.
WORLD_EDITOR_DIRECTOR_PY.COULD_NOT_OPEN_MODEL_FILE: Could not open model file. Shell not added
WORLD_EDITOR_DIRECTOR_PY.MODEL_IS_NODEFULL: Warning: model is nodefull, shell not statically lit
WORLD_EDITOR_DIRECTOR_PY.NORMAL_MAP_NOT_FOUND: Normal map for static decal was not found, a diffuse decal will be created (filename: %0)
